name: John Cornelius
title: Senior Logistics Manager – Multi-Site Supply Chain & Operations
summary: Senior logistics and operations leader with 15+ years’ experience managing multi-site supply chain, warehousing, and manufacturing operations with budgets up to $48M. Proven track record in achieving 95%+ DIFOT, sustaining >99.5% inventory accuracy, and leading safety programs with zero OSHA recordables. Expert in 3PL management, SAP/ERP integration, TPM/Lean Six Sigma, and continuous improvement. Skilled at developing managers and supervisors, driving cross-functional alignment, and delivering cost savings while enhancing service and safety.

Operations Leadership: Safety Program Leadership – Zero OSHA Recordables
Supply Chain Optimization: Delivery in Full On Time (DIFOT) Performance Optimization
Systems & Analytics: SAP / ERP / MES Integration (SAP, Oracle, MS Dynamics)
Lean Six Sigma (Green Belt, Bronze) | Kaizen, Continuous Improvement

experience.title: Sr. Operations & Data Analytics Manager
duties: Directed multi-site logistics and manufacturing operations for 24/7 asphalt production facilities, delivering Safety, Service, and Savings while managing $XXM+ budgets and driving service and cost initiatives.
Led monthly S&OP integrating demand forecasts, maintenance schedules, and supplier lead times to improve and sustain >95% DIFOT.
Managed 3PL relationships, setting KPIs and ensuring adherence to performance metrics for on-time, in-full deliveries and improving cost-per-unit delivered (CPK) by 8%.
Ensured inventory accuracy >99.5% net with cycle counts, bin audits, and process discipline to sustain bin-level accuracy.
Implemented TPM and 5S culture, driving safety, operational efficiency, workforce engagement, and sustaining zero OSHA recordables.
Directed capital projects across multiple sites, meeting budget, timeline, and compliance requirements while hitting safety targets.

Championed and directly led Lean Six Sigma, Kaizen, and data-driven root cause analysis projects from conception through implementation, delivering measurable gains in throughput, quality, cost reduction, and implementing logistics automation solutions.
achievements: Increased regional throughput by 12% while reducing overtime costs through Lean scheduling and predictive maintenance.

Improved DIFOT by 15% by integrating GPS-enabled fleet and delivery tracking software with automated reporting workflows, then applying Monte Carlo analysis and regression modeling to simulate variable conditions and optimize delivery scheduling.

Improved delivery quality scores by 18% by designing a weighted averages formula as the foundation for a machine learning model, enabling proactive quality management and supplier performance improvement.
Achieved >99.5% inventory accuracy across all sites, reducing stockouts and excess inventory carrying costs.
Delivered $2.3M in cost savings by optimizing 3PL contracts, freight routing, and supplier performance.

experience.title: Sr. Program Manager – Aviation & Advanced Systems
duties: Directed lifecycle of multimillion-dollar aviation and special operations programs across multiple global sites, integrating avionics, automation, traditional forecasting methods, and unmanned systems to improve mission readiness.
Led engineering, R&D, logistics, operations, and IT teams, applying program governance, risk management, and Lean/Agile methods to deliver mission-critical capabilities on time and within budget.
Managed global logistics networks, supplier contracts, and maintenance programs for $48M+ in aviation assets, ensuring >95% mission-capable rates.
Directed 3PL partnerships supporting global deployment and sustainment operations, setting performance KPIs, overseeing compliance, and optimizing routes to meet mission timelines.
Implemented advanced telemetry systems, predictive analytics, and planning tools to enhance operational resilience and end-to-end supply chain visibility.
achievements: Reduced part shortages by 22% and improved global mission readiness by applying traditional forecasting methods, predictive supply chain analytics, and proactive maintenance scheduling.

Executed $4.6M flight test program and supported 200+ global missions with zero safety incidents while managing $48M in aviation assets and sustaining >98% mission-capable rates for critical equipment.
Integrated digital twin simulations into mission planning, reducing planning time by 30% and improving multi-site resource allocation efficiency.
Led cross-functional continuous improvement projects using Lean Six Sigma, resulting in measurable gains in operational efficiency and asset utilization.
Improved 3PL on-time performance by 14% through KPI-driven performance management, contract optimization, and data-based route planning supporting global deployment and sustainment.

education.degree: Master of Science (M.S.), Unmanned Systems – Human Factors

body: I am excited to apply for the Senior Logistics Manager – Northeast Region position at Ecolab, as advertised on LinkedIn. With over 15 years of experience leading multi-site supply chain, warehousing, and manufacturing operations with budgets up to $48M, I offer a proven record of delivering Safety, Service, and Savings while improving efficiency, quality, and cost performance.

In my current role as Sr. Operations & Data Analytics Manager at Allmine Paving (A Tamko Company), I lead multi-site operations, improve and sustain >95% DIFOT, manage 3PL partnerships to optimize cost-per-unit delivered, and ensure >99.5% inventory accuracy. My leadership in implementing TPM, Lean Six Sigma, and logistics automation solutions has driven measurable gains, including a 12% throughput increase, 18% improvement in delivery quality, and $2.3M in cost savings.

Previously, as Sr. Program Manager – Aviation & Advanced Systems for the U.S. Army’s 160th SOAR, I managed global logistics networks, directed 3PL partnerships supporting international operations, and sustained >98% mission-capable rates for $48M in critical aviation equipment. These experiences have honed my ability to lead teams, develop managers, and drive continuous improvement across complex, multi-site environments.

I am eager to bring my expertise in 3PL management, SAP/ERP integration, TPM, Lean Six Sigma, and safety leadership to Ecolab’s logistics network. I share Ecolab’s commitment to excellence and operational performance and am confident I can help deliver 95%+ DIFOT, sustain world-class inventory accuracy, and build an engaged, high-performing team.
Thank you for considering my application. I look forward to the opportunity to discuss how my skills and experience align with Ecolab’s goals.
